text: when the Fed wants to fight inflation it
raises interest rates which sets off a
chain reaction in the economy we built
this machine to show you how it works it
all starts when the Fed makes money more
expensive for big banks and hedge funds
and that pushes up short-term and
long-term rates now more people want the
dollar making it stronger and stronger
and more people want bonds so stock
prices fall so while you might earn more
with your savings account you'll pay
more on your credit cards and loans this
might make you buy less which means
businesses could sell less hire fewer
workers and put things on sale all
slowing the economy and if everything
goes as expected inflation will fall but
it's a delicate system and there are a
lot of places where the machine could
fail so like many of us the Fed will be
watching the economy to see what happens
next
